accessibility.text: How do we study atoms?
How do we study atoms?
We measure the frequency (ν) of the light that causes transitions
How do we study atoms?
We measure the frequency (ν) of the light that causes transitions
The strongest transitions are usually in the visible region of the optical spectrum

How do we study atoms?
We measure the frequency (ν) of the light that causes transitions
The strongest transitions are usually in the visible region of the optical spectrum
However, frequencies of visible light are very high – on the order of \t\t
Modern electronics cannot count frequencies this high
However, we can use interference to produce a measurable frequency
